title: WCAS GNDR_ST 382-0-23 Race, Gender, and Sexuality

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This discussion-based course will introduce students to the genealogy and significance of Chicana Feminist thinkers such as Gloria Anzaldúa, Emma Pérez, Antonia Castañeda, Cherrie Morraga, and other artists and activists. It will highlight their contributions to knowledge regarding heteropatriarchy, settler colonialism, race, borders, community organizing, transnationalism, and globalization. More importantly, it will accentuate how Chicana feminists have been foundational to our understanding of decolonial ethics or praxis.
